DataElement.preferredName: Primary Tumor Post Excision Remaining Yes No Not Applicable Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A yes/no/not applicable indicator of whether there was residual tumor after a surgical resection.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to residual primary tumor following resection, removal of tissue or part or all of an organ by surgery.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Occurring first in time or sequence; original. (American Heritage Dictionary):(NEE-o-PLAY-zha) Abnormal and uncontrolled cell growth.

Concepts.definition: Occurring first in time or sequence; original; of greatest rank or importance or value.

A benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation. Benign neoplastic cells resemble normal cells without exhibiting significant cytologic atypia, while malignant cells exhibit overt signs such as dysplastic features, atypical mitotic figures, necrosis, nuclear pleomorphism, and anaplasia. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papillomas, cystadenomas, and lipomas; malignant neoplasms include carcinomas, sarcomas, lymphomas, and leukemias.

Property.preferredDefinition: Post; occuring after.:Removal or excision by surgical measures.:Remaining; enduring or persisting.

Concepts.definition: Happening at a time subsequent to a reference time; later in time or order.
The surgical removal of a lesion, often as part of a biopsy and with healthy margins.
Enduring or persisting; residual, left over or behind.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results or effects (does not include CTC Adverse Events) of therapeutic agents or procedures administered to the patient.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no/not applicable.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A response or indicator that can have a value of yes, no, or not applicable.

Concepts.longName: Yes, No, or Not Applicable Response
Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of yes, no, or not applicable.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Does the patient have a two-d
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a two-dimensional measurable residual tumor greater than or equal to 1 cm2?
